data.text: Have they made thee ruler of a feast?
And when thou hast done all thy office, take thy place,
Speak, thou that art the elder, for it becometh thee, but  with sound knowledge;
Pour not out talk where there is a performance of music,
As  a signet of carbuncle in a setting of gold,
As  a signet of emerald in a work of gold,
Speak, young man, if there be need of thee;
Sum up thy speech, many things in few words;
If thou be  among great men, behave not as their equal;
Before thunder speedeth lightning;
Rise up betimes, and be not the last;
There take thy pastime, and do what is in thy heart;
And for these things bless him that made thee,
He that feareth the Lord will receive his  discipline;
He that seeketh the law shall be filled therewith:
They that fear the Lord shall find judgement,
A sinful man shunneth reproof,
A man of counsel will not neglect a thought;
Do nothing without counsel;
Go not in a way of conflict;
Be not confident in a Gr. without stumbling-blocks. smooth way.
And beware of thine own children.
In every work trust thine own soul;
He that believeth the law giveth heed to the commandment;
